Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown ribbed pottery vessel, fabric is grey-black in section, exterior covered with a brown slip and remains of nine lines of Coptic text written in black ink and containing medical recipe in which magical names are invoked.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.51)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (108461) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/108461)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 20 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
